transcript.sentence: Sanitize one court jars, pour one cup of water into a pot on an oven,
then pour a half cup of white vinegar, one tablespoon of salt, one teaspoon of sugar,
one teaspoon of pepper, corns, one teaspoon of caraway seed, 1.5 teaspoon of dill seed, and stir all the ingredients together with a wooden spoon.
Set aside the pot and grab one jar.
Place garlic and a couple of pieces of fresh dill into the jar, along with kirby cucumbers. Cut into forth.
Pour the pot full of liquid into the jar, and close the lid,
label the jar with dill pickles.
To make bread and butter pickles poor, half cup of white vinegar until a pot on an oven.
Next pour half a cup of cider vinegar, 1/4 cup of water, one cup of sugar, one tablespoon of salt,
one teaspoon of pepper, corns, one teaspoon of dry mustard, three to four cloves,
one teaspoon of celery, seed, a half teaspoon up to merrick, and stir all the ingredients with a wooden spoon.
Grab a jar and place a couple of slices of red chilli into the jar. Layer cucumber slices over the chilli and pour the contents of the pot into the jar.
Label the jar with bread and butter.
To make spicy pickles, pour one cup of white vinegar into a pot on an oven. Next, pour half a cup of water,
one tablespoon of salt, one teaspoon of pepper, corns, one teaspoon of red pepper,
one teaspoon of caraway seed, a half teaspoon of dry mustard. Stir the ingredients using a wooden spoon.
Next, grab a mason jar and place one garlic slice into the jar.
Then place a couple kirby cucumbers, cut into the fords and jalapenos peppers in 3rd jar.
Then pour the contents of the pot into the jar, close the lid, and label the jar as spicy pickles.
Refrigerate the three jars of pickles. These can be stored for up to two months. You can eat your homemade pickles on the side in your hamburgers or placed on Top of the cocktail.

audio_descriptions.notes:
sanitize 1 quart jars
pour 1 cup of water into a pot on an oven. then pour a 1/2 cup of white white vinegar. 1 tablespoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of sugar, 1 teaspoon of peppercorns, 1 tsp caraway seed, 1 1/2 teaspoon of dill seed
stir all the ingredients together with a wooden spoon
set aside the pot and grab one jar
place garlic and a couple of pieces of fresh dill into the jar, along with kirby cucumbers cut into fourths. pour the pot full of liquid into the jar and close the lid. label the jar with "dill pickles"
to make bread and butter pickles, pour 1/2 cup of white vinegar into a pot on an oven. next, pour 1/2 cup of cider vinegar, 1/4 cup of water, 1 cup of sugar, 1 tablespoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of peppercorns, 1 teaspoon of dry mustard, 3-4 cloves, 1 teaspoon of celery seed, 1/2 teaspoon of tumeric. stir all the ingredients with a wooden spoon
grab a jar and place a couple slices of red chili into the jar. layer cucumbers slices over the chili, and pour the contents of the pot into the jar. label the jar with bread and butter
to make spicy pickles, pour 1 cup of white vinegar into a pot on an oven. next pour 1/2 cup of water, 1 tablespoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of peppercorns, 1 teaspoon of red pepper, 1 teaspoon of caraway seed, 1/2 teaspoon of dry mustard. stir the ingredients using a wooden spoon.
grab a mason jar, and place 1 garlic slice into the jar. Next place a couple kirby cucumbers cut into fourths, and jalapeno peppers into the jar. then, pour the contents of the pot into the jar. close the lid and label the jar as spicy pickles
refrigerate the 3 jars of pickles. these can be stored for up to 2 months. you can eat your homemade pickles on the side, in your hamburgers, or placed on top of a cocktail

result.title: 3 Ways To Make Homemade Pickles
result.description:
Here is what you'll need!

Homemade Pickles 3-ways
Makes 3 quarts of pickles 

EQUIPMENT 
3 quart-sized, wide-mouth mason jars with lids

INGREDIENTS
Dill Pickles
Brine
1 cup water
½ cup white vinegar
1 tablespoon salt
1 tablespoon sugar
1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns
1 teaspoon caraway seed
1½ teaspoon dill seed

12 Kirby cucumber spears (3 cucumbers quartered lengthwise)
3 sprigs fresh dill
1 whole clove garlic

Bread & Butter Pickles
Brine
½ cup white vinegar
½ apple cider vinegar
¼ cup water
1 cup sugar
1 tablespoon salt
1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns
1 teaspoon dry mustard 
3-4 whole cloves
1 teaspoon celery seed
½ teaspoon turmeric

Kirby cucumber slices (about 3 cucumbers sliced ¼-inch thick)
Sliced red chili


Spicy Pickles
Brine
1 cup white vinegar
½ cup water
1 tablespoon salt
1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns
1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
1 teaspoon caraway seed
½ teaspoon dry mustard 

12 Kirby cucumber spears (3 cucumbers quartered lengthwise)
1 jalapeño pepper, quartered
1 whole clove garlic

PREPARATION
Fill a large stock-pot with water and bring to a boil. Carefully submerge mason jars with their tops in the boiling water and keep them submerged for at least 5 minutes until ready to use. 
Combine brine ingredients in a medium-sized saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and allow brine to simmer for 2-4 minutes before removing from heat. 
Thoroughly wash all herbs and vegetables (cucumbers in this case) you intend to pickle before cutting them into the desired shape and size. 
Carefully place and arrange the herbs and vegetables inside of the mason jar. 
Pour the warm brine over the vegetables until the mason jar is just about full, making sure to completely submerge the items you want to get pickled. Seal the jar while the brine is still warm and allow to cool completely before placing in the fridge. 
The pickles will reach their peak readiness in 10 days to 2 weeks and can be stored for up to two months.
Enjoy!


Check us out on Facebook! - facebook.com/buzzfeedtasty

MUSIC
People Like Us
